conversations.content: EEEEEEEEEEEEEK!
Heh heh heh. I can already imagine the uses for a toy like this. How greedy of you to try and keep it all for yourself, Augus!
That won't do. No, it won't do at all. I will be taking a piece of this for myself. Heh heh... Aaaaah ha ha ha ha!
Ilia and Meene's House
I'm home, Ilia! That was quite the success.
Oh, hey, Mom. Welcome back. Er, and WHAT was a success, exactly?
Your creations! The people loved them. I heard more than one call you a genius.
Like that strange canister that gives a burst of light when you throw it? The children were just beside themselves with glee. Your alchemy really is quite popular.
Well, I'm glad it's getting the reviews it so richly deserves.
You don't SOUND very glad.
No, I am! It means my alchemy's being useful, right? Who could ask for more?
But I guess the opinions of random  strangers aren't as important to me as certain other things. That's all.
Are you back at that recipe again?
I'll never give it up, Meene; it's what my parents left me. ...Be nice if it wasn't full of gaps and unintelligible bits, but hey, what's a girl gonna do?
You simply cannot leave a mystery be. You've been so ever since you were a girl.
And you think research into other worlds is too dangerous and have told me so a million times SINCE I was a little girl!
You there. Silver-haired girl. Are you Ilia, the alchemist?
Here's a question for you, jarhead: Ever heard of knocking before barging into a lady's humble abode?
Criminals merit no such courtesy. You are to answer for violating the peace with your precious alchemy.
I have no idea what you're on about.
Feigning innocence, eh? That won't do. No, it won't do at all.
An alchemical weapon was used in a terrorist attack in the city a few days ago.
Further investigation revealed that it was developed by your parents.
No! That can't be true!
Your parents researched the military applications of alchemy until the day they absconded with their work.
They were hunted down and slain for their treason, and their work recovered... leaving only a daughter behind.
And you're suggesting I used a weapon they invented as a way of getting revenge against the military?
Avenging one's parents is a tired cliché, but it makes for a fine motive.
You're lying. My parents would never construct tools of war.
Neither me NOR my parents would allow our alchemy to be used to hurt people.
I have not come to hear your excuses. You can shout them at the prison walls once we have you in chains.
THIS is why I hate military types... Okay, fine. You wanna go? Let's go!
Your valor is most impressive, but I am afraid it won't do. No, it won't do at all. Stop and have a look around, hmm?
Meene!
I'm sorry, Ilia. I was careless. Oh, but it pains me to be a liability to you like this!
Not another word, if you value your life. Now then, I am certain a genius alchemist like you can read the writing on the wall?
You're a damn coward. ...But fine. I won't resist. Let her go.
No, Ilia! You mustn't!
Heh heh heh... Aaaaah ha ha ha ha! Oh, but working with a genius is such a pleasure. Always so quick on the uptake!
Alchemist Ilia! I, Logius, hereby arrest you for the high crimes of violence against the people and the disruption of order!
OW, geez! I'm a lady, you jerk! I mean, since you've clearly never handled one of those before!
Ugh, this is the WORST. I have no idea what's even happening...
(Was that Logius guy lying, or did Mom and Dad really use alchemy as a weapon?)
(I don't want to believe that, but I also don't actually KNOW anything about them. So how do I get the truth now?)
Forgive me for speaking to you through bars like this. You are the much-touted alchemical genius, yes? Ilia, was it?
Who's asking?
I am Augus, chief of staff of the army, and I have come here to recruit you. You have ample talents, child—why not use them in service of your country?
Sorry, but I'm not working for the military. My alchemy isn't for hurting people.
Your parents did not appear to share your reservations; their contributions to the cause were considerable indeed.
I'm sure any ＂contributions＂ they made were done at the tip of a sword.
I wonder. I've seen the recipe they left behind—such a thing isn't the sort of work that could be produced under duress.
Wait. They left an intact recipe?
Logius didn't mention it when he collected you? The research your parents stole when they fled was a recipe for something called an omega key.
Is that it?!
It is one page of a copy, yes—but it should be more than sufficient to see the passion they held for the project.
(I have to admit it's possible... You can hear it in the tone of these notes.)
(So were my parents actually...? No! It can't be true!)
And you think this scrap of paper is enough to say what my parents felt in their hearts about their work?
If you do not trust me, why not ask them?
What's that supposed to mean?
If you wish to know the truth of their cooperation with the military, you ought to ask your parents directly.
My parents are dead, jerk—and you animals in the army are what killed them!
Heh heh. It's true, your parents were executed for treason some years ago. And yet...you can meet them still.
If you cooperate as bidden, I will see that you get the chance to speak with them. All is possible with that omega key.
So that's your game: You want me to finish the work my parents started.
Just so. I'm certain it will be a simple task for their daughter, assuming your genius lives up to its reputation.
I suppose you need time to consider this most generous of offers. I will leave these things here for you to look over.
Ah, but before I go... Your parents' original recipes are still in the lab they used.
If you agree to carry on their will and aid us, I would be happy to take you there. Well then, I hope we are able to come to an agreeable arrangement.
My parents were cooperating with the army? And working on an ＂omega key＂?
Gya! I won't get anywhere just climbing the walls like this—I'll have to go there and check it out for myself!
E-explosion! Explosion in the cells!
A little paper and the materials inside the cell were plenty. They don't call me a genius for nothing, bud.
Now let's go see what's REALLY going on with all this!
Undisclosed Military Laboratory
*pant* *huff* Looks like I managed to shake 'em off my tail.
So this was my parents' lab, eh? Well, their recipes must be here somewhere. Time for a good old-fashioned ransack!
...Interesting. I think I've put most of it together at this point.
Their work on the omega key was never completed, but it gave rise to new discoveries that were later adopted by the military.
That weapon Logius said was used in town must be one of them...
But the military would definitely have all that stuff under heavy lock and key, which meeeans...
Well, whatever the case, I won't forgive anyone who uses alchemy to hurt people— especially not with my parents' research!
Gah! They found me!
The fact you would come here is almost too absurd to believe. Yet here you stand.
But this won't do. No, it won't do at all. You were meant to await judgment in your cell like a good little criminal.
I'm no criminal! That attack was an inside job perpetrated by the military!
And just what have you found here, mmm?
These notes show my parents' research into the omega key, as well as how the army adapted it for military use.
And if the same methods described here were utilized in the attack...
Then it is likely the perpetrator was a military member with access to this lab. I admit, there is logic to it.
By way of rebuttal, I would ask you: What of it?
Are you dense? I'm saying you should be investigating your OWN people instead of coming after somebody like me!
Oh, I see little need to investigate; the perpetrator you speak of was myself.
Okay, WHAT?!
Augus asked me to bring you in. I needed a pretext. Your actual guilt in the matter is entirely beside the point.
So you're gonna frame me for a crime YOU committed?!
I found a most delightful toy in here and simply couldn't resist performing a little experiment. Surely you've felt that urge?
I've told you before, I'll never use alchemy to hurt people. Don't lump me in with a monster like you!
Then what does that make your parents?
They would never have knowingly let their work hurt anyo—
NOW who is dense?! You have seen the records here; it's obvious they adapted their research for military use themselves!
They knew full well they were making tools of murder, yet they continued their research all the same.
That can't be true! They meant for the omega key to help people!
You don't even know their faces, yet you are so certain you know their hearts?
I know enough to know they never would have gone along with a big loser like you! And neither will I, you...you RAT FINK!
Oh dear, that won't do. No, it won't do at all.
You know something? Augus asked me to bring you in alive, but I think I am going to kill you here and now instead.
I'll simply have to tell him you were a naughty thing who resisted arrest, leaving me with no choice.
(Crap! The only exit is blocked!)
Ilia!
Meene?! How?!
I have been waiting for the chance to spring you ever since they brought you in.
But then you went and broke yourself out, because of course you did. Do you have ANY idea how hard you are to track?
I know, I know. I'm a terrible daughter. So then! Any chance you thought up a genius plan to escape on your way here?
No plans, but I DID bring a few of your little craft projects along.
That's my mom! Those should be plenty!
Are you morons enjoying listening to them chat? KILL THEM ALREADY!
Hey, any of you guys got kids? I'm told these are all the rage with the young'uns!
M-my eyes! I can't see!
Nwaugh?!
Time to make like a banana and split!
Damn you, girl! You won't escape. Mark my words, I WILL hunt you down!
*gasp* *pant* I think...we're clear...
Well, I'm not sticking around and find out. They'll have sent soldiers to the house, and if they're going to keep chasing us...
We have to leave, Ilia. We have to go far enough that they can't follow—to a place where no one will know who we are.
Aw, are you asking me to elope?
How can you joke at a time like this?!
Just how I'm wired, I guess. Sorry. But look, I can't leave. I've got something I need to finish up here.
Does it have to do with your parents?
Yeah, I may have purloined all of their omega key research back at the lab.
I have to know what was driving them to do this work, which means I need—
Enough. I know better than to try and change your mind once it's set.
Thanks, Mom.
*sigh* I really do spoil her. But if this is what she wants...
Ilia's Hideout
There, just according to the recipe... In theory, it should be complete!
Well, THAT was fast.
Yeah, it helps when you're an alchemical genius. So without further ado... Ta-daaah! My prototype omega key!
Time to give it a whirl and open up an otherworld gate.
Are you certain it's safe? Who even knows what's going to come through?!
Look, I know faeries aren't big fans of otherworld stuff, but tomorrow's successes are built on top of today's failures!
Unless the failure invites a monster into the world that eats you alive...
Forcing connection of opposing poles. Completed conceptual construction of omega key.
Aaaand she's already started. Lovely.
Dedicated mana-kiln conversion rate sub-70. Engaging backup kiln...75...80. Space-time distortion and mana phase transition detected.
Commencing conceptual construction of otherworld gate... Linked. No, wait— errors in the real number conversion. They're rising...
Field stability falling. At this rate, I could burn through all the otherworld fragments I have left and I still don't think it would—
Ilia, wait! I hear footsteps—LOTS of them. I think it may be the military!
You led us on a merry chase, alchemist, but you've nowhere left to run!
Hasn't anyone ever told you that ladies hate the clingy type, Logius?
Oh, that won't do. No, it won't do at all... I will see that forked tongue of yours removed from your spiteful head!
Gah?!
Aaaah!
All of that genius, and it still couldn't save you... What a pity indeed.
Hold on. What's that you're holding? Is it an omega key?!
What if it is?
Ah, I see now why Augus wanted you so very badly...
We have sought that holy grail of alchemy for over a decade—and now here it is, right before my very eyes!
I've just had a delightful idea, girl! If you open a gate here and now, I will spare your sorry life.
You think I'll take orders from you?
Death is all that awaits if you refuse. And I assure you, your faerie friend will be the first to go.
No!
Fine. You win.
Ilia, don't! It doesn't matter what happens to me, you can't—
It's all right, Mom. Trust me.
Now let us see your purported genius! Show me a world that none before have ever succeeded in reaching!
Lucky for you, I was working on opening a gate right before you guys arrived and the prep work is basically done.
All that's left is to stick the key in and turn. Otherworld gate gestalt construction initiated... Linked. Routing to real space.
No key rejection response detected. Gate opening in 3...2...1... Opening!
An otherworld gate! Yesss! This will allow me to surpass Augus with ease! Ah ha ha! AAAAH HA HA HA HA HA HA!
W-what?! I-it's sucking me in! I can't... NOOOOOOOO!
What have you DONE?!
Created an otherworld rift to swallow up my target. Same theory as the weapon you used on the city, but just...bigger.
Take that key from her at once!
Key retrieved, sir! But, uh... how do I use it?
You don't, you fool! You give it to me! I've read her parents' recipe!
Good luuuck. Even I can't operate it in that state, 'cause it's an incomplete prototype.
Then it is a failure? ...Deceitful girl!
YOU'RE the one who assumed it worked. Besides, I said before I'd never help a rotten rat fink like you!
And just what, pray, does that make your parents—they who so eagerly worked to make new and exciting tools of murder?!
That was their choice. This one is mine.
And, uh...shouldn't you be running? Believe me, being sucked into a rift is NOT a pleasant way to go.
I'm not dying here! Ruuuun!
Everyone who wants to live, get the hell out of here NOW!
Stand your ground, cowards! That is an order!
That's our cue. Let's bolt!
Did you know that would happen all along?
I told you to trust me, didn't I? Now let's get moving!
THIS WILL NOT DO AT ALL!
Ilia! Behind you!
Gah?! Let go of me, Logius, or we're BOTH gonna die here!
Then you will perish in fine company!
Meene, get out of here! I'll be right behind—WAAAAAUGH!
Wait, Ilia! ILIAAAAAAAA!
I can't believe stupid Logius dove headlong into an otherworld rift just so he could drag me along with him!
Well, dying with him in a space-time hole is NOT high on my to-do list, so lemme just find a way to... Ah! There's the rift!
You're not going anywhere, girl!
Knock it off, weirdo! If we don't get out of here soon, we'll get stuck in the space between worlds!
You have humiliated me at every turn, and I will bear it no longer!
Ugh, he's not even listening. Looks like I don't have a choice...
Don't blame me for this, rat fink! Blame your own dumb greed!
Gwaugh?!
Good, the rift is still open. I just need a few more...
No... NO! I was too late! Damn, damn, DAMN!
Just existing in here puts a heavy burden on a body. The otherworld fragments I've got will buy me...maybe a few minutes?
Poor Meene must be furious. All I ever did was worry her and make her depressed. And as a good buddy of mine likes to say, that won't do. No, it won't do at all...
Huh? What's that light?
—a, can y—ear our voi—s?
Wait... Dad? Mom?
—eloved daughter. This isn't how I hop— —ould meet, but it's such a joy to see you.
There's so much I want to ask you. SO much. So many things to talk about. Things I never got the chance to say.
We feel the same, but time is short. We'll have to settle for telling you the most important thing.
What's that?
We researched other worlds since long before you were born in pursuit of a single dream.
That dream was corrupted along the way, taken by the military to be used in war. But even still, we had faith.
In what?
In the endless possibilities the otherworld gate holds. Its power can make any dream come true, and produce things that we never dared imagine!
We didn't live to see that dream realized, but it needn't die with us...if you wish it.
There's so little we were able to leave you, but we still have faith that our dream can lead you to a happy future.
How happy can it be if you aren't there? What kind of future is THAT?!
Reach out to the light, Daughter.
This is...the omega key? The one Logius took?
Ilia, the omega key we designed holds boundless possibilities.
We believed in its potential—in the future it might bring. That's what drove all of our work, and it seems to have driven you, too.
Me?
You are our greatest joy, and all we ask is that you find joy in turn.
We are a part of your future still. Just knowing we passed our curiosity and hope down to you is enough for us.
But what if it's not enough for ME? Stay with me. Teach me. PLEASE!
You will understand in time. But for now, it's time to go. ...Use the key, Ilia.
A happy future is waiting for you on the other side.
—Ilia?!
Meene? So I'm...outside the hideout? I made it back?
Oh, I'm SO glad you're alive!
Yeah, I actually thought this might have been the end.
Well, now we've all learned our lessons and can put this otherworld business to rest for good and all!
Actually, uh... I'm REALLY close to finishing this key for real.
You got sucked into a space-time hole and STILL haven't had enough?! Incorrigible! Also, you know the army will never let this go, correct?
Oh yeah, good point. Maybe we should have this convo in a safer place.
(I don't know if those voices were my real parents or a hallucination, but either way, my mind's made up.)
(I'll keep doing my research to build a happy future, just like they did.)
(Dad... Mom... Thank you. And goodbye.)
Reporting in, sir! We searched the area thoroughly, but found no sign of Major Logius's remains.
Our conclusion is that the witness reports from his men claiming he was pulled into an otherworld rift are accurate, sir.
An appropriate end for a greedy fool. ...Well? Anything else?
We sighted a girl matching the description of the alchemist he was pursuing in a nearby city.
According to the report given by Logius's men, she was supposed to have been swallowed up by the rift along with him.
So either your scouts are mistaken or she made it back alive. And if the latter is true, it means she has a working key.
Ha ha ha ha! Splendid! I knew I was right about that girl from the first!
Stop looking for Logius and inform the search party they are to bring me that alchemist immediately.
Yes, sir!
Soon, Ilia... Soon you will be mine.
